poem:
**Opalescent Echoes**

From Kingston's quiet Thames
to the Royal halls, where
fingertips alight, each
note a pulse, Immune 
to silence. Singular stars
across the psychedelic night,
Monsters whisper in scores— 
the piano's voice, tender
and bold, Jon's melody
wakes the world, 
Ivor listens, Novello
nods.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "On my radar: Jon Hopkins’s cultural highlights Born in Kingston upon Thames in 1979, musician and producer Jon Hopkins studied piano at the junior department of the Royal College of Music. He played keyboards for Imogen Heap before releasing his solo debut album Opalescent in 2001. His subsequent albums include the Mercury-nominated Immunity, the Grammy-nominated Singularity and 2021’s Music for Psychedelic Therapy. His soundtrack for the 2010 film Monsters was nominated for an Ivor Novello". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
